snippet: On Monday night in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference final, Jimmy Patsos directed Loyola (Md.) to its first N.C.A.A. tournament berth since the Skip Prosser-coached Greyhounds in 1994.
abstract: Loyola Maryland men's basketball team defeats Fairfield, 48-44, to win the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference tournament and its first NCAA tournament berth since 1994.
lead_paragraph: On Monday night in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference final, Jimmy Patsos directed Loyola (Md.) to its first N.C.A.A. tournament berth since the Skip Prosser-coached Greyhounds in 1994.

headline.seo: Loyola (Md.) Wins MAAC Title and N.C.A.A. Bid
headline.main: Antics Aside, Coach Gains His First Berth in N.C.A.A. Tournament
headline.print_headline: His Team Earns a Bid, But It’s Loyola’s Coach Who Puts On a Show
